did.abstract: This collection contains the parish records of the St. Nicholas Church in Export, Pennsylvania. It contains baptism, marriage and funeral records, as well as membership lists and legal documents.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access and use of this collection may be subject to restrictions. Please contact the archivist (archives@ukrhec.org) for more information and to make arrangements. Access is limited due to fragile condition.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); St. Nicholas Parish (Export, Pa.) Records; box number; folder number; Ukrainian Historical and Educational Center Archives, Somerset, New Jersey.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Export, Pennsylvania was a coal mining area during the first half of the 20th century. The mines employed many immigrants, especially from Eastern Europe, and the St. Nicholas parish served that community. Although many of the records in this collection are in Ukrainian, it is clear that the parish consisted of many ethnicities, including Serbs and Rusyns. Like many of the parishes founded in the early 20th century, it suffered from declining membership and closed in the 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in three series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Baptism records (1914-1917), marriage records (1914-1929, 1922-1941, 1945-1969), funeral records (1921-1927, 1935, 1941-1976). Contains significant number of entries for non-Ukrainians, including Serbs and Roman Catholics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This volume has been attributed to the Export, PA parish based on the internal evidence of the home towns of the individuals mentioned in the records (primarily Export and Slickville), as well as the overlap of clergy names with the other volume (which is clearly labled as being from Export). Baptism records (1913-1976). Ledger entries, including list of parishoners and their donations?/loans? (1918). Contains a significant number of entries for non-Ukrainians, including Serbs and Roman Catholics with non-Slavic names.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Property deeds, mortgage documents, and survey map.
